column4: Anyone please to point me where to configure my 6600gt component video to work with my hdtv please
anyone that has done this with video cards?
I don;t know where to start
I did a lot on fedira all I could get was to make it look good in 720p but only in a 4:3 kinda screen
naw....someone would've done far worse than that
I have widescreen, 540p (which is the same fundamentally as 1080i).
running from composite, mythtv with an HDTV tuner card.
I had 1080i running for a while, but I switched back to 540p because it seems to take less cpu but is identical in quality.
let me see if I can dig up the guide I used....

ah yes, this is for Fedora, but it woks for us too.  http://wilsonet.com/mythtv/mythhd.php.  I just kept messing with the line until I got what I wanted, because I don't have any Windows machines to run Powerstrip.
no, 720p is better than either 1080i or 540p.  But I don't have that.
so if you can get 720p, go for that.
sec, I'll tell you how to troubleshoot
okay, how I troubleshot that was, I ran "startx -- -logverbose"  (yes, exactly like that).  Then, check your /var/log/Xorg.0.log
oops, wait
startx -- -logverbose 5 sorry, I left off the 5 before.
it will tell you why it wouldn't run a particular modeline.
the X.org stuff works pretty much the same as Fedora, if that's what you mean.
sorry, I know nothing about that option.
most likely, that should work on ubuntu if it works on Fedora, esp since Ubuntu uses a newer X.org I think.
yes, I did mode blocks, but its the same to X.
I have to hit the sack.  If you are unsuccessful, send me a private message, or you can email me at dmartin@dmartin.org and I will try to help.
